backend/main.mo: Minimal Motoko canister with an empty actor.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report mapping PWA install-related features to frontend files and components.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Contains prewritten summaries for all frontend source files including screens, components, hooks, and utilities.
frontend/DELIVERY.md: Documentation explaining the app is a PWA with offline support and no Android APK.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind CSS base and theme variables defining light/dark color tokens and global styles.
frontend/index.html: Main HTML entry file with PWA metadata, manifest link, service worker registration, and root mounting div.
frontend/public/manifest.webmanifest: PWA manifest defining app name, icons, theme colors, and standalone display mode.
frontend/public/sw.js: Service worker implementing cache-first offline support for core assets.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main React app managing navigation between screens with slide transitions and session context.
frontend/src/components/AppShell.tsx: Layout shell with header, language toggle, history button, and PWA install handling with fallback dialog.
frontend/src/components/InstallOnAndroid: Dialog component showing instructions for installing the PWA on Android via browser menus.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and caches a backend actor tied to the current Internet Identity and refreshes dependent queries when the identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides Internet Identity auth context, managing login, stored identity loading, status flags, and logout functionality.
frontend/src/hooks/usePwaInstall.ts: Tracks PWA install prompt availability and exposes a function to trigger installation.
frontend/src/i18n/I18nProvider.tsx: Provides language state, persistence, direction handling, and a translation function for the app.
frontend/src/i18n/translations.ts: Defines French and Arabic translation dictionaries used by the i18n system.
frontend/src/index.css: Sets Tailwind base styles with custom color variables, dark mode, touch settings, and RTL support.
frontend/src/lib/accessPoints.ts: Exports static access point definitions and a helper returning the icon path.
frontend/src/lib/pdf/exportToPdf.ts: Generates a printable PDF-like HTML page for visitor and vehicle records using bilingual labels.
frontend/src/lib/pdf/templates.ts: Provides French and Arabic label templates for use in PDF generation.
frontend/src/lib/storage/indexedDb.ts: IndexedDB helpers for opening the database, saving and retrieving visitor and vehicle records, and updating exit times.
frontend/src/lib/storage/types.ts: Type definitions for VisitorRecord and VehicleRecord used in storage operations.
frontend/src/lib/validation.ts: Validation utilities for required fields, time format, and ensuring exit times are after entry times.
frontend/src/lib/vehicleTypes.ts: List of vehicle types with IDs and a helper returning the static vehicle icon path.
frontend/src/main.tsx: App entry point initializing React, React Query, and Internet Identity provider.
frontend/src/screens/EntryTypeScreen.tsx: UI screen letting users choose between visitor or vehicle entry before proceeding.
frontend/src/screens/HistoryExportScreen: Loads, filters, edits, and exports visitor and vehicle history records, including exit time updates and PDF export.
frontend/src/screens/HomeScreen.tsx: Initial setup screen for supervisor name and access point selection with validation.
frontend/src/screens/SplashScreen.tsx: Simple splash screen with fadeâ€‘in animation and branding.
frontend/src/screens/VehicleFormScreen.t: Form for creating vehicle entry records with validation and IndexedDB save logic.
frontend/src/screens/VisitorFormScreen.t: React screen that manages visitor form state, validates required/time fields, saves records to IndexedDB, and resets/navigates on success.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS config defining theme colors, container settings, animations, and plugins including typography and container queries.
project_state.json: Project metadata describing app purpose, architecture, requirements, known issues, and existing implemented features.
